articles.title: During COVID, everyone became a DIYer. Now, poor choices are coming back to haunt homebuyers.
articles.description:
It’s one thing to regret your own kitchen island — too large for the space as it turned out — or the gray vinyl flooring you just had to have, or maybe the walls you knocked down in an open-concept mania. It’s even worse to buy a home and inherit a stranger’s bad choices — […]

articles.title: Lowell’s Ty Chan transferred to UConn to get closer to home. His niece, battling leukemia, couldn’t be happier.
articles.description:
Last November, as Notre Dame geared up for the College Football Playoff, offensive lineman Ty Chan learned that his beloved niece, Olivia Kazanjian, had been diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia just before her fifth birthday. Chan, a Lowell native and Lawrence Academy product, did his best to compartmentalize and savor the run of a lifetime […]
